offering.title: Code Engine
offering.announcement.title: Disruptive update to batch capability on 7/22
offering.announcement.description: As we continue to enhance IBM Cloud Code Engine we will need to deploy a disruptive change to our batch capability on 7/22. During this change all your batch jobs and definitions will be removed, running jobs will be aborted and you will need to recreate them after the change is done. To continue using our CLI, please follow the instructions to download our new code-engine

clg.page.overview.title: IBM Cloud Code Engine
clg.page.overview.subtitle: Run your application, job or container on a managed serverless platform. Auto-scale workloads and only pay for the resources you consume.
clg.page.components.title: Components
clg.page.components.subtitle: Components are building blocks of your project that let your code run according to its purpose.
clg.page.components.th.name: Name
clg.page.components.empty.card.applicati: Applications run your code to serve HTTP requests, autoscale even down to zero and offer traffic routing to multiple revisions. Get started by creating an Application.
clg.page.components.empty.card.jobdefini: Jobs run your code as a one-time task until completion. Jobs are submitted based on Job definitions. Get started by creating a Job definition.

Jobs run your code as a one-time task until completion. Jobs are submitted based on Job definitions.

clg.page.cli.title: Install the IBM Cloud Code Engine CLI plug-in
clg.page.cli.setup.prereq.title: Before you begin
clg.page.cli.setup.prereq.text: Make sure you have the latest version of the IBM Cloud CLI installed.
clg.page.cli.setup.step.first.title: 1. Install the IBM Cloud Code Engine plug-in
clg.page.cli.setup.step.second.title: 2. Verify the plug-in is installed
clg.page.cli.setup.step.third.title: 3. Test it
clg.page.cli.setup.moreinfos: Learn more about the IBM Cloud Code Engine CLI.
clg.page.overview.section.explore.title: Explore the capabilities
clg.page.overview.section.explore.teaser: Make run-to-completion components a part of your application. Offload long-running and resource-hungry tasks to asynchronous jobs that allow for optimized scale and cost efficiency.
IBM Cloud Code Engine automatically scales your workloads up and down, and even down to zero when there are no requests. You only pay for the resources you consume.
Build great applications in any language, using your favorite libraries and tools, and then deploy them to our serverless container platform in seconds.
IBM Cloud Code Engine is built on Kubernetes and Knative, allowing you full access to the container ecosystem tooling, making sure that your workloads remain portable.
clg.page.overview.section.concepts.tease: Projects contain entities such as applications and jobs.
Applications run your code to serve HTTP requests.
Jobs run your code as a one-time task until completion. Jobs are submitted based on Job definitions.
clg.page.overview.section.tutorials.feat: In this tutorial, you will learn about IBM Cloud Code Engine by deploying an object detection application to a IBM Cloud Code Engine cluster.
More tutorials will be coming soon.

clg.cmp.envvariables.name.invalid.REGEXP: A valid name must consist of alphabetic characters, digits, '_', '-', or '.', and must not start with a digit

clg.cmp.envvariables.title.edit.label: Edit environment variable
clg.cmp.envvariables.description.text: You can add a literal variable, which is a simple name/value pair, a ConfigMap key reference or a secret key reference. Select the desired type of your variable below, then provide the necessary input.
Your targeted project doesn't have any secrets defined. Please select another option.
Your targeted project doesn't have any secrets defined. Please select another option or select 'container image' to revert back to the original value.
clg.cmp.envvariables.empty.secret.label: This Secret has no items to display.
clg.cmp.envvariables.empty.secret.title: Empty Secret
clg.cmp.envvariables.empty.secret.desc: The selected Generic Secret has not items. You first need to create items in a secret for them to show up here for selection.
clg.cmp.envvariables.empty.configMap.com: Your targeted project doesn't have any ConfigMaps defined. Please select another option.
Your targeted project doesn't have any ConfigMaps defined. Please select another option or select 'container image' to revert back to the original value.

clg.cmp.envvariables.empty.configMap.des: The selected ConfigMap has not items. You first need to create items in a ConfigMap for them to show up here for selection.
